channel.title: Itunes
channel.description: Ok, I have a Visa cash card with 15 dollars on it. On itunes store I used that for my account creation. I have purchases that are over 15 dollars, but I can still buy stuff, does anybody know what is happening?

item.title: Itunes
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

um in the uk… i think for example mine… it will let me do more purchases if i have no money in… but then the bank will charge me for being on an unplanned overdraft…

Careful with these as LloydsTSB tried charging me £98 for being overdrawn £4 for 5 days

Read full topic

item.title: Itunes
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“nohope, post:6, topic:324944”][quote author=inertia link=topic=421302.msg3094313#msg3094313 date=1263149786]
The iPod itself shouldn’t carry account authentication credentials, so don’t worry about that. It’s probably a flaw in the system if it’s letting you spend more than what you have available on the visa card, or maybe the visa card source is being charged? Like say your mum bought the card for you, maybe she did something wrong and she will be charged any amount over the $15 monthly.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 10, 2010, 12:58:28 pm[/size][hr][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=421302.msg3094146#msg3094146 date=1263140228]

Ok, I have a Visa cash card with 15 dollars on it. On itunes store I used that for my account creation. I have purchases that are over 15 dollars, but I can still buy stuff, does anybody know what is happening?

You’re using a shit piece of software, expect it to break/not function properly.
[/quote]
Yeah iTunes is made to sync nicely with the iPod and allows you to buy music legally… I know, let’s Winamp!!

Got any suggestions?
[/quote]It’s just like a cash card that is not reloadable so I don’t know if I should keep buying stuff and wait and find out who is being charged.[/quote]

You shouldn’t really carry on buying stuff if you might be charging someone. Did you go into a store and physically buy the card?

If the card and your itunes store account are in no way linked to a bank account or credit card you should be fine, but bear in mind you probably gave them your address when you created an account so they might invoice you or something…

Read full topic

Got any suggestions?[/quote]It’s just like a cash card that is not reloadable so I don’t know if I should keep buying stuff and wait and find out who is being charged.
